content: प्राणः {@--1@} Breath, respiration. {@--2@} The breath of life, vitality, life, vital air, principle of life (usually <ab>pl.</ab> in this sense, the Prāṇas being five; प्राण, अपान, समान, व्यान and उदान); प्राणैरुपक्रोशमलमिसैर्वा <ls>R. 2. 53</ls>; <ls n="R.">12. 54</ls>; (हदि प्राणो गुदेऽपानः समानो नाभिसंस्थितः . उदानः कंठदेशस्थो व्यानः सर्वशरीरगः ..). {@--3@} The first of the five life-winds or vital airs (which has its seat in the lungs); <ls>Bg. 4. 29.</ls> {@--4@} Wind, air inhaled. {@--5@} Energy, vigour, strength, power; as in प्राणसार <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--6@} The spirit or soul (<ab>opp.</ab> शरीर). {@--7@} The Supreme Spirit. {@--8@} An organ of sense; <ls>Ms. 4. 143.</ls> {@--9@} Any person or thing as dear and necessary as life, a beloved person or object; कोशः कोशवतः प्राणाः प्राणाः प्राणा न भूपतेः <ls>H. 2. 92</ls>; अर्थपतेर्विमर्दको बहिश्चराः प्राणाः <ls>Dk.</ls> {@--10@} The life or essence of poetry, poetical talent or genius; inspiration. {@--11@} Aspiration; as in महाप्राण or अल्पप्राण <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--12@} Digestion. {@--13@} A breath as a measure of time. {@--14@} Gum-myrrh.
